trans-unit.source: DSC for Linux nxScript Resource
trans-unit.target: DSC for Linux nxScript Resource

trans-unit.source: The **nxScript** resource in PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to run Linux scripts on a Linux node.
trans-unit.target: The **nxScript** resource in PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to run Linux scripts on a Linux node.

trans-unit.source: Syntax
trans-unit.target: Syntax

trans-unit.source: Properties
trans-unit.target: Properties

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: GetScript
trans-unit.target: GetScript

trans-unit.source: Provides a script that runs when you invoke the [Get-DscConfiguration](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn521625.aspx) cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Provides a script that runs when you invoke the [Get-DscConfiguration](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn521625.aspx) cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: The script must begin with a shebang, such as #!/bin/bash.
trans-unit.target: The script must begin with a shebang, such as #!/bin/bash.

trans-unit.source: SetScript
trans-unit.target: SetScript

trans-unit.source: Provides a script.
trans-unit.target: Provides a script.

trans-unit.source: When you invoke the [Start-DscConfiguration](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn521623.aspx) cmdlet, the **TestScript** runs first.
trans-unit.target: When you invoke the [Start-DscConfiguration](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn521623.aspx) cmdlet, the **TestScript** runs first.

trans-unit.source: If the **TestScript** block returns an exit code other than 0, the **SetScript** block will run.
trans-unit.target: If the **TestScript** block returns an exit code other than 0, the **SetScript** block will run.

trans-unit.source: If the **TestScript** returns an exit code of 0, the **SetScript** will not run.
trans-unit.target: If the **TestScript** returns an exit code of 0, the **SetScript** will not run.

trans-unit.source: The script must begin with a shebang, such as `#!/bin/bash`.
trans-unit.target: The script must begin with a shebang, such as `#!/bin/bash`.

trans-unit.source: TestScript
trans-unit.target: TestScript

trans-unit.source: Provides a script.
trans-unit.target: Provides a script.

trans-unit.source: When you invoke the [Start-DscConfiguration](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn521623.aspx) cmdlet, this script runs.
trans-unit.target: When you invoke the [Start-DscConfiguration](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn521623.aspx) cmdlet, this script runs.

trans-unit.source: If it returns an exit code other than 0, the SetScript will run.
trans-unit.target: If it returns an exit code other than 0, the SetScript will run.

trans-unit.source: If it returns an exit code of 0, the **SetScript** will not run.
trans-unit.target: If it returns an exit code of 0, the **SetScript** will not run.

trans-unit.source: The **TestScript** also runs when you invoke the [Test-DscConfiguration](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn407382.aspx) cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: The **TestScript** also runs when you invoke the [Test-DscConfiguration](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn407382.aspx) cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: However, in this case, the **SetScript** will not run, no matter what exit code is returned from the **TestScript**.
trans-unit.target: However, in this case, the **SetScript** will not run, no matter what exit code is returned from the **TestScript**.

trans-unit.source: The **TestScript** must return an exit code of 0 if the actual configuration matches the current desired state configuration, and an exit code other than 0 if it does not match.
trans-unit.target: The **TestScript** must return an exit code of 0 if the actual configuration matches the current desired state configuration, and an exit code other than 0 if it does not match.

trans-unit.source: (The current desired state configuration is the last configuration enacted on the node that is using DSC).
trans-unit.target: (The current desired state configuration is the last configuration enacted on the node that is using DSC).

trans-unit.source: The script must begin with a shebang, such as 1#!/bin/bash.1
trans-unit.target: The script must begin with a shebang, such as 1#!/bin/bash.1

trans-unit.source: User
trans-unit.target: User

trans-unit.source: The user to run the script as.
trans-unit.target: The user to run the script as.

trans-unit.source: Group
trans-unit.target: Group

trans-unit.source: The group to run the script as.
trans-unit.target: The group to run the script as.

trans-unit.source: DependsOn
trans-unit.target: DependsOn

trans-unit.source: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.
trans-unit.target: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the **ID** of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is **ResourceName** and its type is **ResourceType**, the syntax for using this property is `DependsOn = "[ResourceType]ResourceName"`.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the **ID** of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is **ResourceName** and its type is **ResourceType**, the syntax for using this property is `DependsOn = "[ResourceType]ResourceName"`.

trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.target: The following example demonstrates the use of the **nxScript** resource to perform additional configuration management.
